channel.title: 4. Building AI Systems on The AI Engineer's Handbook
channel.description: Recent content in 4. Building AI Systems on The AI Engineer's Handbook

item.title: Embeddings & Vector Search
item.description: Understanding embeddings: turning text into high-dimensional vectors. Embedding models (OpenAI, Sentence Transformers). Vector databases: Pinecone, Weaviate, Chroma, FAISS, pgvector, Qdrant. Vector search: similarity metrics (cosine, dot product), indexing (HNSW, IVF), nearest-neighbor at scale. Use cases: semantic search, recommendations, anomaly detection.

item.title: RAG Systems
item.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation: the “open book” approach. Architecture: grounding AI in external data to reduce hallucinations. Pipeline: document ingestion, chunking strategies, embedding, retrieval (similarity search), generation (prompt augmentation). Evaluating RAG quality.

item.title: RAG Orchestration
item.description: Frameworks for building RAG pipelines: LangChain, LlamaIndex, Haystack. Chains and runnables. Document loaders and splitters. Retriever abstractions. Advanced patterns: hybrid search, reranking, query transformation. When to use a framework vs. building from scratch.

item.title: AI Agents
item.description: Defining autonomy: models that use tools, reason through tasks, and pursue goals. Reasoning patterns: ReAct (Reason + Act), Chain of Thought, step-back prompting, reflection. Agent loops: observe, think, act. Planning and task decomposition. Tool use and function calling.

item.title: Building Agents
item.description: Implementation approaches: manual loops vs. frameworks. Tools: OpenAI Functions/Tools API, Anthropic tool use. Frameworks: LangGraph, Google ADK, CrewAI, AutoGen. Defining tools and schemas. Error handling and retries. Memory and state management.

item.title: Multi-Agent Systems
item.description: Orchestrating multiple agents. Patterns: supervisor/worker, hierarchical, collaborative. Agent communication and handoffs. LangGraph for stateful multi-agent workflows. Parallel vs. sequential execution. Debugging and observability. Production considerations.

item.title: Model Context Protocol
item.description: MCP: a standard for connecting LLMs to data and tools. Architecture: hosts, clients, servers, transport layer. Building MCP servers for custom data sources. Integrating with Cursor, Claude Desktop. Resources, tools, and prompts. Security considerations.

item.title: Multimodal AI
item.description: Beyond text: handling images, audio, and video. Vision: image understanding (GPT-4V, Claude Vision), image generation (DALL-E, Midjourney, Stable Diffusion). Audio: speech-to-text (Whisper), text-to-speech. Video: understanding and generation. Building multimodal applications.

item.title: AI Safety & Security
item.description: Security risks: prompt injection, jailbreaking, data extraction. Reliability: hallucinations, bias, inconsistency. Mitigations: input validation, output filtering, moderation APIs (OpenAI). Guardrails and content policies. End-user IDs for abuse prevention. Red-teaming and adversarial testing.

item.title: LLM Evaluation
item.description: Measuring LLM quality. Benchmarks: MMLU, HumanEval, HELM. RAG metrics: precision, recall, faithfulness. Custom evaluation frameworks. Human evaluation and annotation. A/B testing in production. LLM-as-a-judge patterns. Continuous monitoring and regression detection.

item.title: MLOps & Cloud Platforms
item.description: Experiment tracking: MLflow, Weights & Biases. Model registries and versioning. Pipeline orchestration: Airflow, Prefect. CI/CD for ML. Cloud platforms: GCP Vertex AI (training, serving, ADK), Azure ML, AWS SageMaker. Comparing costs, features, and when to use each.
